steps.title: Regular exercise is a great way to build muscle.
steps.content: Regular exercise is a great way to build muscle. Try activities that target a lot of different muscles, like swimming, biking, or dancing. Even simple activities like stair climbing, jogging, and walking are great forms of exercise. Aim to exercise for 60 minutes each day—it’s okay if you break your workout into smaller chunks. [2] X Research source Reader Poll: We asked 157 wikiHow readers if they found cardio effective for losing weight, and 73% of them said yes. [Take Poll] So that's something to keep in mind if you're interested in weight loss.

steps.title: Eat between 1.4 to 2 g of protein for every 1 kg (2.2 lb) you weigh.
steps.content: Eat between 1.4 to 2 g of protein for every 1 kg (2.2 lb) you weigh. Protein-rich foods can help you build and maintain muscle. [3] X Research source Lean meats, like beef and pork, and poultry, like chicken and turkey, are great sources of protein. Dairy products, fish, seafood, beans, and nuts are also excellent protein sources. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Your biceps are an important skeletal muscle.
steps.content: Your biceps are an important skeletal muscle. [5] X Research source Dumbbell curls and hammer curls are great options to strengthen your biceps if you have weights at home. Resistance bands are another great way to strengthen your biceps. [6] X Research source If you don’t have weights of your own, you can make your own set at home .

steps.title: Your pectorals, or front chest muscles, are a valuable skeletal muscle.
steps.content: Your pectorals, or front chest muscles, are a valuable skeletal muscle. [7] X Research source Bench press exercises are an excellent way to strengthen your pecs. If you don’t have weights, push-ups are another great way to build this skeletal muscle. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Your quads, or upper leg muscles, are skeletal muscles.
steps.content: Your quads, or upper leg muscles, are skeletal muscles. [9] X Research source Simple squats, lounges, and jumps are great ways to strengthen your quads. Try starting out with some back squats, split squats and goblet squats. If you have weights at home, try squatting with a barbell or kettle bell. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Your external obliques are skeletal muscles found near your abs.
steps.content: Your external obliques are skeletal muscles found near your abs. [11] X Research source Work your obliques with side planks, or give yourself an extra challenge with side plank dips. Side bends, side kicks, and wood choppers are also great ways to work these muscles. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Your hamstrings are a skeletal muscle along the back of your legs.
steps.content: Your hamstrings are a skeletal muscle along the back of your legs. [13] X Research source Hamstring curls are a great way to work these muscles, as are kettlebell and dumbbell deadlifts. Walking lunges are another great way to strengthen your hamstrings. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Your glutes are skeletal muscles that cover your bottom.
steps.content: Your glutes are skeletal muscles that cover your bottom. [15] X Research source Strengthen your glutes with simple exercises like glute bridges or side squats. Bulgarian split squats are another great way to work your glutes. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Your lats, or upper back muscles, are skeletal muscles.
steps.content: Your lats, or upper back muscles, are skeletal muscles. [17] X Research source Pull-ups are a classic, easy exercise that really work your lats. Medicine ball slams and reverse-grip barbell bent-over rows are other excellent workouts. [18] X Research source
